message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This study uses the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys dataset and a new dataset on political connections to investigate the relationship between firm-level political connections and access to finance in developing countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys", "new dataset on political connections"], "topic": ["Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze a large-scale dataset of household survey data from Haiti to estimate the local average treatment effect of education on labor market outcomes using an instrumental variable approach.", "dataset": ["household survey data from Haiti"], "topic": ["Education"]}, {"sentence": "This paper exploits the variation provided in two micro datasets: (i) individual level data on prime age men from the National Longitudinal Survey (NLS) of Youth and (ii) aggregated manufacturing industry-level data from the Annual Survey of Manufacturers (ASM)", "dataset": ["National Longitudinal Survey (NLS) of Youth", "Annual Survey of Manufacturers (ASM)"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze a unique dataset of school inspections data and daily teacher attendance records to examine the relationship between school inspections, teacher incentive policies and teacher absenteeism in India.", "dataset": ["school inspections data", "daily teacher attendance records"], "topic": ["Education"]}, {"sentence": "This analysis uses data from the DHS conducted in multiple countries to explore the association between maternal empowerment and child stunting in South Asia and sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "Using a new dataset of over 200,000 public procurement auctions, we document substantial variation in the use of subcontracting across US states and purchasing agencies.", "dataset": ["new dataset of over 200,000 public procurement auctions"], "topic": ["Public-Private Partnerships"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses a unique dataset of individual-level financial linkages data to investigate the relationship between bank network structure and systemic risk in the banking sector.", "dataset": ["individual-level financial linkages data"], "topic": ["Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "We exploit variation in government audit schemes and administrative data on fiscal revenues to identify the causal impacts of fiscal audits on taxpayer behavior in Mexico.", "dataset": ["administrative data on fiscal revenues"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "The analysis combines an unprecedented dataset on stock prices for firms listed on the Johannesburg Stock Exchange together with a comprehensive new dataset on patent applications filed by South African inventors at various patent offices around the world.", "dataset": ["dataset on stock prices for firms listed on the Johannesburg Stock Exchange", "new dataset on patent applications filed by South African inventors at various patent offices around the world"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "Using a unique dataset of agricultural survey data, we provide evidence that shocks to the agriculture industry have spillover effects across the entire community as measured by a decline in social capital.", "dataset": ["agricultural survey data"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "This study uses the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys dataset and a new dataset on political connections to investigate the relationship between firm-level political connections and access to finance in developing countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys", "new dataset on political connections"], "topic": ["Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze a
